etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Edinburgh New Philosophical Journal. From poly- + base + -ite, after German Polybasit

definitions: A mineral of the hexagonal crystal system that is a sulphide and antimonide of silver and copper, (Ag,Cu)₁₆ Sb₂ S₁₁, and occurs as thin, tabular, black, metallic crystals.
